data.title: Sorry to say but No Thank You!
data.text: When the kids saw the free ice cream sign we stopped in on a whim while out and about in Portsmouth. The buffet was lack luster. Waitress acted like we a big inconvience to her.  The interior was gross.

data.title: Not what it use to be
data.text: This use to be one of the best restaurants in town however over the last several years, it has become a let down.  It isn't as clean as it use to be and the service isn't as great.  If they would remodel a little it might draw more people in.  Also, the food quality use to be excellent now most of what they have is a buffet that has been sitting out all day.

data.title: Worst Chinese Ever
data.text: Save your money and cook at home, or go to Jade Villa in Virginia Beach for quality Authentic Chinese Food.

data.title: This place has really gone downhill
data.text:
We ate here after a visit to the Children's Museum across the courtyard.  We came in at about 5 PM, and they still had the lunch food on the buffet.  Everything was either soggy or dried out.  I have a strong stomach, but this food turned it and put me in the water closet for a good while after I got home.  The interior is way past shabby, and the floor was very sticky.  Servers were very impatient which was odd since they barely spoke English and there was only one other table occupied.

It had a Trip Advisor sticker on the door, which now makes me suspicious of just how does Trip Advisor decide who gets these stickers.

We ate here several years ago, and while it was not exactly gourmet, it was much better than what is going on now.  Next time we will head over to Roger Brown's across the street

data.title: Worth avoiding
data.text: Who could mess up the Chinese experience?  Our expectations are just so low. The buffet is a mess, The fortune cookies were stale but the food off the menu was fair.   It would deserve worse stars, since the device was absent, but for the classic dry sautéed during beans. The rocked. Even they couldn't screw them up.

data.title: The Worst Dining Experience I Ever Had
data.text:
Living here in Olde Towne it was always a family tradition to celebrate birthdays at China Garden. The former manager, Steve, and his staff were wonderful. We saw them so often that they knew all of us by name, and knew our buffet favorites as well. The food was great, and the service exceptional.
It is not the case any more. Steve and his staff are no longer there and the people that have replaced them are seemingly doing their best to lose China Garden all their business!!!
I took my son there yesterday for his birthday, 7/22. What a disaster!!!We arrived just at the beginning of dinner service, 5pm. Everything was empty on the buffet. We attempted to take a seat and were told to stop by a surly young waitress. She then escorted us through the empty restaurant to a tiny table in sight of the bathrooms - which are filthy and broken - and the kitchen. No welcome..not a smile...nothing. I wanted to move to the actual restaurant but did not because I assumed it was booked. It was not - she seated other guests in there during the short time we were there. The buffet was not maintained so we only ate a little, the surly young waitress did not bother to fill up my sons drink, or ask if we needed anything and then walked up to our table and tried to remove the plates we had in front of us while we still had the utensils in our hands!!!! We didn't even get to finish our meals!Walked up to pay and had to wait 5 minutes while the rude young waitress was talking to someone in the kitchen. When she came back and sullenly received my payment she didn't smile or say "thank you."
Working at a the Front Desk here in Olde Towne I usually have about 30 or 40 hotel guests per day ask me about a good place to eat. For the past few months when I have been referring them to China Garden the ones that go come back with the same type of complaints...the buffet isn't properly maintained, or the restaurant closes early hurrying the paying buffet guests out. You can be sure from this time on that no one in my family will ever return, nor will I ever reccomend it to a guest. There is actually a very good Chinese restaurant just a few blocks away called China Ocean - and they will get all of our referrals from this point on. Their food is good, and they are friendly and welcoming, unlike this new staff at China Garden that seem to be intent on driving all the regular customers away.

data.title: Avoid the buffet.  Go for the take-out
data.text:
China Garden's buffet used to be amazing back in the late 90s.  Today, it's merely a trough of oil drenched goo.

Having said that, the quality of the take-out selections are some of the best in the area.  I always go for the trifecta of Madarin Tripple Crown, Happy Family and House Fried Rice.

data.title: By far the worst Chinese restaurant in the area
data.text: The service was terrible, the food is even more terrible and the staff seem hostile. I won't ever eat there again.

data.title: Great Marketing, Food Almost as Good
data.text:
It’s immediately across a small plaza from the Children’s Museum. My five year old niece couldn’t read a lot of things at the time, but she did manage to see the words “Free Ice Cream” on the window sign. So we know that this restaurant knows how to market itself.

The restaurant offers a buffet as well as a menu. The buffet was a little bit sparse, but it was reasonably priced and the items on it were fresh, hot, and tasty. I found plenty to satisfy both of us. The service was friendly, with drink refills and the clearing of plates occurring quickly. It was a very good place to visit in the middle of a fun day.

data.title: For a Chinese food in Portsmouth, this is above-standard both in food and service.
data.text: For a Chinese food in Portsmouth, this is above-standard both in food and service.
